## Purpose
Demo/example Django apps showing how to use the `django-fast-frontend` library. `app` has a fully configured `AuthorFrontend`; `app2` has a minimal `PeopleFrontend`. These are excluded from the PyPI package.

## Architecture Flow
```
Django startup → FrontendConfig.ready() → site.autodiscover_modules()
  → imports app/frontend.py → @frontend.register(Author) → AuthorFrontend stored in _registry
  → imports app2/frontend.py → @frontend.register(People) → PeopleFrontend stored in _registry
```

## Key Files
| File | Responsibility | Key Exports |
|---|---|---|
| `app/models.py` | `Author` model (name, title, birth_date) | `Author` |
| `app/frontend.py` | Full ModelFrontend example with all features | `AuthorFrontend` |
| `app/tests/test_frontend.py` | Integration tests for auth and access | Test functions |
| `app2/models.py` | `People` model (name, title, birth_date) | `People` |
| `app2/frontend.py` | Minimal registration example (pass-through) | `PeopleFrontend` |
| `app/static/css/` | Custom theme CSS files (blue, purple, rgb) | Static assets |

## Patterns
Registration uses decorator pattern:
```python
@frontend.register(MyModel)
class MyModelFrontend(frontend.ModelFrontend):
    fields = ('field1', 'field2')
```
Alternative (commented in app2): `frontend.site.register(Model, FrontendClass)`

## Do / Never
- **DO**: Always set `fields` explicitly — see `AuthorFrontend` example
- **DO**: Name frontend classes as `{Model}Frontend`
- **DO**: Place registration in `{app}/frontend.py` (autodiscovered)
- **NEVER**: Use `fields = "__all__"` — will trigger security test failure

## Common Tasks
### Add a new model to an existing app
See global instructions "Quick Start" section. Additionally for demo apps: set permissions (`add_permission`, `change_permission`, `delete_permission`) explicitly in the `ModelFrontend` subclass.

## Testing
- Run: `python -m pytest app/tests/ -v`
- Uses `django.test.Client`, `User.objects.create_user()` for auth
- All tests require `@pytest.mark.django_db` decorator
